newsitem.title: USA: NCR Corp, Sensar sign distribution deal.
newsitem.headline: NCR Corp, Sensar sign distribution deal.

text.p: NCR Corp said Tuesday it signed a deal to distribute the identity verification system of privately-held Sensar Inc.

Under terms of the deal, NCR will distribute and service the identification system on a non-exclusive basis to financial institutions globally except in Japan. NCR, a supplier of automated teller machines, said it expected to launch the product in the fourth quarter.
Sensar signed a $41.9 million distribution pact with Oki Industry Co Ltd last October, granting Oki exclusive rights in Japan and non-exclusive rights in 10 Pacific Rim countries.
Sensar and NCR both declined to put a dollar amount on the deal.

"The technology is still in the pre-production phase, so we haven't set a price on it yet," an NCR spokesman said. Sensar Chief Financial Officer Kevin McQuade said the company received an $8 million investment in January from the venture capital arm of J.P. Morgan & Co Inc to help develop the IrisIdent technology, which uses digitally encoded images of the human iris as a means of identification.
He also said the company planned to launch a public equity offering in the near future.
"We're planning to take (the company) public as soon as we can, probably within six months," McQuade said. Sensar has not yet filed for an offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
